edu.utah.cdmcc.editors
Class GlucoseDecisionCalculatorEditor

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.core.commands.common.EventManager
      org.eclipse.ui.part.WorkbenchPart
          org.eclipse.ui.part.EditorPart
              edu.utah.cdmcc.editors.GlucoseDecisionCalculatorEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDatabaseListener, IPatientsListener, java.util.EventListener, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IAdaptable, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IExecutableExtension, org.eclipse.swt.events.FocusListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.ModifyListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.SelectionListener, org.eclipse.swt.internal.SWTEventListener, org.eclipse.ui.IEditorPart, org.eclipse.ui.ISaveablePart, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart2, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart3, org.eclipse.ui.part.IWorkbenchPartOrientation
public class GlucoseDecisionCalculatorEditor
extends org.eclipse.ui.part.EditorPart
implements IPatientsListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.SelectionListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.ModifyListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.FocusListener, IDatabaseListener

GlucoseDecisionCalculatorEditor is part of the Utah Decision Support Tools. This handles instantiating decisions and then calling routines to fire the rules engine (Drools).

Author:
J. Michael Dean, M.D., M.B.A.

Initial version: Aug 4, 2006 8:26:47 PM

University of Utah School of Medicine, Salt Lake City, Utah

Copyright 2005 - 2008. All rights reserved.

Purpose of the class: Edits a patient decision object (glucose decision).

createPartControl

public void createPartControl(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent)
Create the editor for glucose decisions, based on the appropriate composite. Add a whole shitload of listeners, etc. which I hope to replace with data binding routines to simplify the code.

But this works, so hey, why complain?

databaseChanged in interface IDatabaseListener

calculateDecision

private void calculateDecision()
This calculates a decision. It checks to make sure which inference engine is used. This is because this development effort began with Jess instead of Drools, and to allow the potential to add or change inference engines in the future. Currently, only Drools is used.

First, instantiate a decision object (which populates everything) and then call the routine to fire the engine.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

fireDroolsRulesEngine

private void fireDroolsRulesEngine()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
This routine loads the Drools rules, creates a Drools session, and then inserts the decision objects that are needed for the glucose decision support.

Then the routine fires the rules engine.

Then the decision object is updated and the main plugin has its listeners notified.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

declineDecision

private void declineDecision()
This routine sets the action to Decline, and charts this. However, it needs to allow the user to add a comment about why he or she declined the decision.

acceptDecision

private void acceptDecision()
Sets the chart to indicate user accepted the advice. May want to add routines to permit adding comments.

chartDecision

private void chartDecision()
Add the decision to the patient object so that we can consider the decision retrospectively. This would be the routine that preserves all ludicrous human behavior for posterity to enjoy.

instantiateDecisionObject

private boolean instantiateDecisionObject()
Populates a decision object so that it can be fed to the rules engine shredder (currently Drools) and then processed. This is responsible for making sure that all relevant fields are populated.

Returns:
status of whether the decision object was successfully created.

addTimeFields

private void addTimeFields(java.lang.String hm)
Figure it out. This adds the time fields to the decision so that it can be properly fed to the rules engine.

Parameters:
hm -
